thread.title: Ryan Uccellini gets goal to lift Albany Academy to soccer win
thread.title_full: Ryan Uccellini gets goal to lift Albany Academy to soccer win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Ryan Uccellini gets goal to lift Albany Academy to soccer win
text:
Ryan Uccellini scored the game's only goal in the 39th minute to lift Albany Academy to a Colonial Council victory over Ichabod Crane in a boys' soccer match on Friday afternoon.
Emanuel Gomez assisted on the goal. The Cadets got eight saves from goalkeeper Ian Donlon . Peter Volkman stopped three shots for the Riders.
Albany Academy, which is second in the Liberty Division , is 12-4 both in league and overall play. Ichabod Crane, first in the Patriot Division, is 13-3 overall and in the league.
More boys' soccer: Freshman Daniel McCarty scored on a free kick from 25 yards out in the 78th minute as Mekeel Christian Academy beat Galway 1-0 in the Western Athletic Conference championship game at Maalwyck Park in Scotia. McCarty drove a shot over the left side of the wall that dipped just below the crossbar in the upper left of the goal to scored the game winner with less than two minutes to play in regulation. JP Howard had five saves as the Lions posted their 11th shutout of the season to improve to 14-0. Galway got a pair of saves from Shane Brownell . ... Samuel Statham scored two goals and Tyler Biernacki, Bryan Drossel and Silas Yelich added a goal each to lead Greenville past Coxsackie-Athens 5-0 in a Patroon Conference game.
Girls' soccer: Alexis Riffelbach had three goals and two assists as Catholic Central got past visiting Holy Names 6-0 in a Colonial Council game. The Lady Crusaders, who got five saves from Abby Fountain, improved to 13-3 with the win. ... Emma LeMay scored the goal and Delaney Piper recorded the shutout by stopping 14 shots as Emma Willard stopped host Berlin 1-0 in a Central Hudson Valley League encounter. The Mountaineers got 21 saves from Jordan Cahill . ... Alexa Ray and Deanna Calhoun each scored a pair of goals to lead Cairo-Durham to a 6-2 Patroon Conference win over Taconic Hills. Natasha Zacchio and Nylah Interrannte each added a goal for the Mustangs. Hanan Ibrahim and Rachel Nielsen scored for Taconic Hills and Alexandra Skabowski made 17 saves.
Girls' volleyball: Catholic Central outlasted Holy Names and won by scores of 25-18, 18-25, 25-21 and 26-24 in a Colonial Council encounter. Megan Rumenapp had 28 assists, seven kills and three aces to pace the Crusaders. Lexah Pyskadlo had eight kills and 17 digs for Holy Names. ... Paige Phelan had 18 service points and 13 aces to lead Mechanicville to a 25-11, 25-22, 25-19 win over Granville in Wasaren League play. Shawna Baker had eight aces for the Golden Horde.
Field hockey: Ally Burdick scored two goals and Cassie Shuman made one save to spark Hoosick Falls (16-0, 12-0) to a 4-0 win over Emma Willard (7-7, 6-2) in a Wasaren-Adirondack League game. Sasha Bonsteel made 16 saves for Emma Willard.
Girls' tennis: Haejin Lee, Mia Fallati, Kyra Fuleihan, Keanna Cruz and Maya Zhou all won in straight sets to lead Shaker to a win over Shenendehowa, 8-1, in the Class AA semifinals. ... Burnt Hills won the Class A title with a 5-2 win over Averill Park. Brittany Katz, Kaila Dudley , Sallie Suski and Hope Fischer won their singles matches in straight sets.
